Mbappe, the 25-year-old French soccer team captain and forward, did not start in the Euro 2024 Group D game against the Netherlands on Friday due to an injury he sustained during the team's win over Austria on Monday. The injury resulted in a broken nose and a brief period of time on the sidelines.

Although Mbappe attended training on Thursday wearing a mask with the French flag colors, manager Didier Deschamps announced that he would be a substitute player. In his place, Antoine Griezmann and Marcus Thuram were selected to initiate the match as attacking players.

Before the game began, Mbappe changed his mask to one of a single color, as per Uefa's rules. Griezmann, Mbappe's teammate, expressed his disappointment over Mbappe's absence and acknowledged the substantial impact his teammate has on the team.

Griezmann stated, "As a team, we must adjust to this situation. The inclusion or exclusion of Mbappe significantly alters the team's performance, and we need to remain adaptable in soccer. We'll have to deal with different scenarios, and that should be our strength."

27.0_en:
A couple were taken to hospital after they were recovered from the water

A man has died after his car entered water during Storm Bert. The man, aged in his 80s, was recovered by emergency services from water on Cockhill Lane, Foulridge, Colne, where Noyna Ford is located, at about 16:15 GMT on Saturday, Lancashire Police said. He was taken to hospital where he was pronounced dead. A woman, aged in her 80s, was also recovered from the water and remains in hospital where her condition is described as not life threatening.

Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service sent two fire engines to the scene. Firefighters from Nelson and Penwortham who are specialist swift water rescue teams were involved along with a boat from Preston. The man’s death is not being treated as suspicious and a file will be passed to the coroner, police said. Homes and roads have seen some flooding across the UK during heavy rain, particularly in Wales, with more than 100 flood warnings in place across Britain.
• None Body found in search for man missing during Storm Bert
27.1_en:
A couple in their 80s were rushed to hospital after being pulled from the water by emergency services. A man, who had been involved in a car accident that sent his vehicle into the water on Cockhill Lane, Foulridge, Colne, near the location of Noyna Ford, sadly lost his life. He was pronounced dead at the hospital after being recovered by emergency responders at approximately 16:15 GMT on Saturday. A female companion, also in her 80s, was rescued from the water and is currently receiving treatment at the hospital, where her condition is reported to be not life-threatening. 

Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service dispatched two fire engines to the scene, with specialist swift water rescue teams from Nelson and Penwortham, along with a boat from Preston, assisting in the rescue efforts. The man's death is not being treated as suspicious and a file will be passed to the coroner for further investigation. Meanwhile, heavy rain across the UK has led to widespread flooding, with over 100 flood warnings issued across Britain, particularly in Wales.

Unfortunately, the male passenger suffered severe injuries, which ultimately proved fatal at the hospital around 4:15 pm on a Saturday. Meanwhile, the female passenger was successfully rescued from the water by emergency responders and is now receiving treatment at the hospital, showing encouraging signs of recovery.

The Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service swiftly responded to the situation by dispatching two fire engines, rescue teams from Nelson and Penwortham, and a boat from Preston to aid in the rescue operation. Initial police investigations indicate that the man's death was not linked to any suspicious circumstances. The case will be transferred to the coroner for a thorough investigation.

The UK is currently facing severe weather conditions, with approximately 100 flood warnings in place across the country, affecting areas in Wales.

28.0_en:
Manchester City have signed Japan goalkeeper Ayaka Yamashita on a three-year deal from INAC Kobe.

It is the first time the 28-year-old has joined a club from outside her home country.

Yamashita said she is "very hungry" and looking forward to the challenge of playing in England's top flight.

"I've won various trophies in Asia, but to level up myself I felt the need to take on a challenge," she added.

"It's a famous club that everyone knows, and even now, it feels unbelievable to me."

Yamashita, who played with City midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy, has featured 74 times for her country and has won 17 major honours during her career.

She is the Women's Super League club's third Japanese signing of the transfer window following the arrivals of Risa Shimizu from West Ham United and Aoba Fujino from Tokyo Verdy.
28.1_en:
Manchester City have secured the services of Japan goalkeeper Ayaka Yamashita on a three-year contract from INAC Kobe, marking her first move to a club outside of her native country.

At 28 years old, Yamashita expressed her eagerness to take on the challenge of competing in England's top division, stating that she is "very hungry" for the experience.

Yamashita cited a desire to elevate her skills by stepping out of her comfort zone, saying, "I've achieved success in Asia, but to further develop myself, I felt the need to accept a new challenge."

She also acknowledged the prestige of joining Manchester City, describing it as an "unbelievable" opportunity.

Throughout her career, Yamashita has represented her country 74 times and accumulated 17 major titles. She previously played alongside Manchester City midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy.

Yamashita becomes Manchester City's third Japanese signing of the transfer window, following Risa Shimizu from West Ham United and Aoba Fujino from Tokyo Verdy.
28.2_en:

Yamashita shared her motivation behind the move, explaining that she wanted to enhance her abilities by stepping out of her familiar surroundings. She noted, "I have achieved significant accomplishments in Asia, but to continue growing, I felt the necessity to embrace a fresh challenge."

She also highlighted the honor of joining Manchester City, referring to it as an "incredible" opportunity.

Throughout her professional journey, Yamashita has donned the Japanese national team jersey 74 times and amassed a total of 17 major awards. Previously, she played alongside Manchester City midfielder Yui Hasegawa at Tokyo Verdy.

29.0_en:
Police have released dramatic footage of officers ramming a scooter rider following a high-speed pursuit.

The dashcam footage shows the Hampshire police vehicle pursuing a black Honda 125cc scooter at speeds of 60mph in a 30mph limit on The Avenue, Southampton.

The 23-year-old rider, who was carrying a pillion passenger, was forced off the bike near The Common where he then fled.

He was arrested a short distance away and was found in possession of cannabis.

After being convicted in court, the rider was fined, given a suspended jail term, and banned from the road for three months.

29.1_en:
A scooter rider, age 23, was pursued by Hampshire police at approximately 60mph on The Avenue in Southampton, despite the speed limit being 30mph. The dashcam video obtained by the police depicts this high-speed chase.

The rider, who had a passenger on the scooter with him, was eventually forced to dismount near The Common. Following his dismount, he attempted to flee on foot.

He was apprehended shortly thereafter and was discovered to be in possession of cannabis.

Upon being tried in court, the rider received a fine, a suspended prison sentence, and a three-month driving ban.

The chase came to an end near The Common, where the rider tried to evade capture by fleeing on foot, but was ultimately apprehended by the authorities. Following his arrest, a search of the individual found cannabis on his person.

The scooter rider was held responsible for his actions in court and faced penalties, including a fine, a suspended prison sentence, and a three-month ban on driving.
